summary: Joseph Timothy White is a PFC who reportedly defected to North Korea. The documents primarily concern efforts to gather information about White's background, personality, and associations, particularly during his time at Kemper Military School & College (KMSC). An agent report details an interview with Henry D. Glaister concerning White's background, associations, and political views during his time at KMSC. The documents also involve obtaining permission from Henry D. Glaister to release an agent report about White to his father, Norval White Jr. Joseph C. Merlino, who knew White at KMSC, was also interviewed.
significance: The significance of Joseph Timothy White in the JFK context is not explicitly stated in the provided documents. The documents suggest an investigation into White, possibly related to his defection to North Korea, but the connection to the JFK assassination is unclear from the information provided.
